question.body: What is the division of the nervous system functions to trigger the fight or flight response?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The somatic division controls skeletal muscle not the fight or flight response.
Correct. The sympathetic division of the autonomic nervous system causes the increased heart rate and blood pressure typical in the fight of flight response.
Incorrect. The parasympathetic division is part of the autonomic, not somatic nervous system.
Incorrect. The parasympathetic division functions for the daily "housekeeping" functions, not the fight or flight response.

question.body: Which of the following occurs when the sympathetic nervous system is activated?

multiple_choice.choice: increased breathing (respiratory) rate) and dilation of bronchioles
all of the above occur when the sympathetic division is stimulated

response.feedback: Partially correct. But there are many changes that occur when the sympathetic division is stimulated.
Partially correct. But there are many changes that occur when the sympathetic division is stimulated.
Partially correct. But there are also additional changes that occur.
Correct. All of these events occur simultaneously when the fight or flight response is stimulated.

part.hint: The sympathetic nervous system causes many responses to occur at once.
